JukeBox Architecture

The basic SPMIDI API is designed to be used by one thread. The same thread that send MIDI commands, or advances the MIDI file player, should be the same thread that reads the synthesized audio. The JukeBox is designed to allow one thread to send commands and another thread to read and play the audio. The first thread can be part of an application while the second thread may be a callback from an audio device driver.

The JukeBox contains an atomic command FIFO that sits between the application side and the synthesis side. The Application queues songs, play notes, etc. and the commands will go into the FIFO. When the audio thread calls JukeBox_SynthesizeAudioTick() then the commands are pulled from the FIFO. Control commands are executed immediately. MIDI commands are placed in the Event Buffer. And songs are placed in the Song Queue.
